extendedIngredients.name: grapeseed oil
extendedIngredients.originalString: Canola or grapeseed oil for brushing grill grate

extendedIngredients.name: heirloom tomatoes
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 large beefsteak or heirloom tomatoes, thinly sliced

extendedIngredients.name: sun-dried tomato pesto
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ cup prepared basil pesto or sun-dried tomato pesto

recipes.title: Caprese Pizza

winePairing.pairingText: Sangiovese, Barbera Wine, and Shiraz are my top picks for Pizza. The best wine for pizza depends on the toppings! Red sauce pizza will call for a red wine with some acidity, such as a barberan or sangiovese. Add pepperoni or sausage and you can go bolder with a syrah. The Story Winery, Sangiovese, Estate, Shenandoah Valley with a 5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 19 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Story Winery, Sangiovese, Estate, Shenandoah Valley
productMatches.description: Aromas of raspberry, cherry, pie crust, tobacco and oak greet the nose. Dark cherries and raspberry predominate the palate with mild tannins and nice acidity. The finish is gentle and lasting Enjoy!

recipes.instructions: 1. Brush grill grate well with oil, and preheat grill to medium.2. Spread pesto over crust. Top with tomato slices, mozzarella, and basil. Place pizza on grill, close lid, and grill 5 minutes, or until cheese has melted. Sprinkle with Parmesan, if using.

steps.step: Brush grill grate well with oil, and preheat grill to medium.2.
Spread pesto over crust. Top with tomato slices, mozzarella, and basil.
Place pizza on grill, close lid, and grill 5 minutes, or until cheese has melted. Sprinkle with Parmesan, if using.
